Afrikaans: Kan jy raai wie ons beste vriend is?   Hy is glad nie soos ons nie.
Ons beste vriend is Voël!
Ek is Renoster.Ek raak oortrek met vlooie.
Voël eet hulle almal op.
Ek is Krokodil.Ek kan nie my tande borsel nie.
Voël pik my tande skoon.
Ek is Kameelperd.Ek kan nie my kop krap nie.
Voël kan net die regte plek bykom.
Ek is Sebra.Ek kan nie baie ver sien nie.
Voël het goeie oë, en wanneerhy op die uitkyk is, is ek veilig.
Voël mag anders wees, maar dis nie ’n probleem nie …
Ons gee nie eens om as hy sing nie!
English: Can you guess who our best friend is? He’s not like us at all.
Our best friend is Bird!
I am Rhino. I get covered in fleas.
Bird eats them all up.
I am Crocodile. I can’t brush my teeth.
Bird pecks them all clean.
I am Giraffe.I can’t scratch my head.
Bird can reach just the right spot.
I am Zebra. I can’t see things far away.
Bird has great eyes, so when he’s watching I’m safe.
Bird might be different, but that’s no problem…
We don’t even mind when he sings!

Afrikaans: “O nee!”
“Lulu, ons moet nou gaan!” roep Mamma.
Waar is Lulu? Is sy onder die bank? Is sy agter die gordyn?
Waar is Lulu? Is sy langs die stoof? Is sy in die kas?
“Lulu, kom nou! Waar’s jy?”roep Mamma weer.
“Dáár’s jy!”“Ek wil nie gaan nieee!”
“Ons móét gaan,” sê Mamma.“Maar ek hou régtig vandié een!”
“Ek hou régtig van dié een!”
“En dié een.”
“En dié een.”“En dié een.”
“Sien jy? Mens bring jou boeketerug en dan neem jy nog uit.”“JEI!”
Waar is Lulu nou?
English: “Oh, no!”
“Lulu! It’s time to go,” calls Ma.
Where is Lulu?Is she under the sofa?Is she behind the curtain?
Where is Lulu?Is she next to the stove?Is she in the cupboard?
“Lulu! It’s time to go. Where are you?” calls Ma.
“There you are!”“I don’t want to gooo!”
“We have to go,” says Ma.“But I really like this one!”
“I really like this one!”
“And this one.”
“And this one.”“And this one.”
“See? You return books and borrow more.”“YAY!”
Where is Lulu now?

Afrikaans: Muis soek ’n huis.
Dit lyk na ’n lekker huis.
“Jy kan by my kom slaap,” sê Babahondjie.“Dankie,” sê Muis.
Daardie aand is Muis se drome springerig en modderig.
“Jy kan by my kom slaap,” sê Papegaai.“Dankie,” sê Muis.
Daardie aand is Muis se drome rasering en wild.
“Jy kan by my kom slaap,” sê Vis.“Dankie,” sê Muis.
Daardie aand is Muis se drome koud en nat.
Muis het ’n plek nodig wat warm en droog is.
Muis vind ’n boekrak daar naby.
Daardie aand droom Muis snoesige drome.
Goeienag, Muis.
English: Mouse was looking for a new house.
This looks like a nice house.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Puppy. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were bouncy and muddy.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Parrot. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were noisy and wild.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Fish. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were cold and wet.
Mouse needed somewhere warm and dry.
Mouse found a bookshelf nearby.
That night, Mouse had warm and cosy dreams.
Good night, Mouse.

Afrikaans: Papa!
Moenie bang wees nie.
Weg, Woef-woef!
Kyk, Hondjie bring die bal.
Bal?
Hondjie wil speel.Speel?
Vang die bal.
Weg, Woef-woef!
Kyk, Pappa speel.
Nou speel jy.
Vang, Woef-woef!
English: Daddy!
Don’t be scared.
Woof-woof out!
Look, Doggy’s bringing the ball.
Ball?
Doggy wants to play. Play?
Catch the ball.
Woof-woof out!
Look, Daddy’s playing.
Now you play.
Catch, Woof-woof!
